lines.content: This is a greenfield Java project based on [this project template](https://github.com/nus-cs2103-AY2425S1/ip). It's named after _Kat_ now (Before, it was named after the Java mascot _Duke_). Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/chatbot/Main.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Main.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
1. The JavaDoc comments were partially done with Claude Sonnet 3.5.

Sample self-written JavaDoc comments and JavaDoc guidelines from the [Java coding standard](https://se-education.org/guides/conventions/java/index.html) were provided to the AI to generate more comments.
Comments created by the AI are vetted and edited.
1. Git commit message were partially generated with Calude Sonnet 3.5.

Sample self-written Git commit message body and [Git conventions](https://se-education.org/guides/conventions/git.html) were provided to the AI to refine and generate new commit message bodies. Messages created by the AI are vetted and edited.
1. [user.png](src/main/resources/images/user.png) and [chatbot.png](src/main/resources/images/chatbot.png) were both generated using DALL-E.

Kat helps you to easily track and manage your daily tasks.
1. Ensure you have **Java 17** installed on your system.
1. Download the latest `kat.jar` from the releases page.
1. Navigate to the directory where `kat.jar` is located and run the following command:
Adds a Todo task to the list.
Adds a Deadline task to the list.
Adds an Event task to the list.
Displays all tasks in the list.
Marks a completed task as not done.
Removes a task from the list.
Searches for tasks containing specific keywords.
* Entry point for the JavaFX application.
* It calls the launch method of the Application class, passing the Main class and any command-line arguments.
* @param args Command line arguments to be passed to the JavaFX application
* The Main class contains the entry point of the application.
* It initializes and starts the chatbot.
* Sets up the necessary components and starts the chatbot.
* @param stage The primary stage for this application
* Represents a chatbot capable of handling user interactions.
* @return A String containing the welcome message.
* Generates a response based on the given user input.
* @return A String containing the chatbot's response to the user's input.
* Checks if user's input is the termination command.
* @return True if input message is the termination command, false otherwise.
* Represents a parser capable of handling various types of user messages.
* Handles the input message and returns an appropriate response.
* @param input The user's input message to be processed.
* @return A string response based on the processed input.
* @throws InvalidMessageException If the input message is invalid or cannot be processed.
* Represents storage system for managing tasks.
* Adds a new task to the storage.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Retrieves a task from the storage by its index.
* @param taskIdx The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Returns the number of tasks in the storage.
* @param taskIdx The index of the task to mark as done.
* Marks a task as not done.
* @param taskIdx The index of the task to mark as not done.
* Removes a task from the storage.
* @param taskIdx The index of the task to delete.
* Finds tasks containing the given keyword in their description.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* @return A list of tasks that match the keyword.
* Implements the ChatBot interface representing a chatbot named Kat.
* This class handles user interactions, processes input, and generates responses.
